snippet.title: Billionaire James Packer returns to Crown Resorts board
snippet.content:
Billionaire businessman James Packer has officially rejoined the board of Australia's biggest casino operator, Crown Resorts. On the eve of the company's annual results, to be revealed on Friday, Crown informed the stock exchange that Mr Packer had now received all the necessary approvals to be .

James Packer returns to Crown board
A management shake-up at Crown Resorts, after a horror run in 2016, could leave investors a little confused.
Mr Packer has remained the largest shareholder of Crown Resorts through his private investment company, but . His 18-month absence has been a troubling time for the Australian casino giant, following the jailing and .Photo: Bloomberg Crown employees, including head of VIP operations Jason O'Connor, were sentenced to prison in a Shanghai court earlier this year, and were collectively fined more than $1.6 million. Mr O'Connor is expected to be released this month. The company was subsequently by selling much of its stake in joint-venture casinos in Macau and shelving plans to build a new casino in Las Vegas.Photo: Bloomberg Crown's executive chairman, John Alexander, said on Thursday that Mr Packer and Guy Jalland, a trusted legal adviser to Mr Packer, had been appointed directors of the company, effective immediately.
